CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1953, pg. 27, reads: "Good Friends Gather - Two old friends, both outstanding catchers, got a chance to swap tales at Forbes Field last week during the Brooklyn Dodgers - Pittsburgh Pirates series. Roy Campanella, one of baseball's all-time great receivers, had a chance to tell W. P. Young the difference between baseball as it was played in Negro National League and the major leagues today.  Young was a former all-time catching great with the Homestead Grays - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Brooklyn Dodgers baseball player Roy Campanella seated in dugout with former Homestead Grays catcher William P. Young
